No, that's not what I mean. By nature EM waves don't normally make sound. T=
he HAARP issue in the NW is believe to be caused by some harmonic of the ac=
tual EM wave. This is what I mean by secondary effect. EM waves can still e=
ffect the physical, which is the reason microwaves can cook you if the powe=
r is amped high enough or causes a birds to twitch in its transmission beam=
. I have stepped into a microwave beam at moderate power in while in the mi=
litary. It doesn't hurt (at least at the power it was at) but it sure made =
me feel very strange. Of course microwaves have very short wavelengths comp=
ared to VLF, ULF or SLF.
=A0
Frank R.

EM waves at the VLF and=

ds like a low hum to some people! I believe the most famous of these phenom=
enon was caused by HAARP.

April, standard physics today defines four fundamenta=
l types of forces: electromagnetism, gravity,=A0 and the strong and weak in=
teraction of elementary particles.=A0 So while EM is one type of energy (we=
ll, lets call it a force), there are a few others too.

Tell me where the seperation=
 on the spectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves caus=
e pressure waves that our ears read as vibration and our mind translates as=
 sound. The waves are still on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic =
geomagnetic waves are present on the scale. What I mean by power can be dir=
ectll translated to volume or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes =
soundwaves from any other wave is the fact that we can hear them.
=A0
Frank=
 R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:

m

No. Sounds waves are not on t=
he electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Soun=
d waves are based on pressure waves in the air (or in other substances).=A0=
 Our ears detect these pressure waves and translate them into sounds we her=
e.=A0 Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy.=A0 Our eyes do: that part w=
hich we call visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18ei=
i@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject:=
 Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8,=
 2009, 12:38 PM









It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."
=A0
=
A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there are two differen=
t types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic =
waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and power. Radio wav=
es are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of the electromagnie=
tic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just farther down wit=
h much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost any=
thing because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more way=
s we can shield against them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. These are also a typ=
e of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physic=
al effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed up, which create=
s heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physica=
l objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in plac=
e. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the total system conser=
ves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Frank R.

, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:

=

From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>

Here is some food for thought. I am curren=
tly reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=A0
It was me and a=
nother girl teammate=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice =
on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were standing right n=
ext to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my night vision c=
amera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl =
that was with me to check her recording to see if she picked it up.
=A0
I h=
ave long felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environmen=
t, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are a=
ppearing directly on the recordings.
=A0
This instance with the recorders m=
ay back that theory up. That other recorder should have picked that voice u=
p if it were sound waves in the environment.
=A0
I am attaching the clip of=
 this 3rd voice. The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is the full cli=
p.=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in righ=
t after that. I think I know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was live monitoring=
 my audio, but still did not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I=
 am not as excited about it as my one's from the last investigation.
=A0
=
=A0

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ide=
as








I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wav=
e and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the =
heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one anoth=
er in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you get a beat fr=
equency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal=
 at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic fre=
quency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference=A0frequency at=
 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an ex=
ample, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by tu=
rning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were generated withi=
n a few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce this affect in=
 not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and au=
dio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio sp=
otlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

So much we don't know ...

Message -----

Sent: Mo=
nday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM

I am curi=
ous if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any =
EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investigation of Ashmore Estate=
s, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in t=
he three halls of the building. The video for all=A0was being monitored and=
 recorded=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the=
 camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder what we might have=
 heard if we did?
=A0
Zack

<TD vAlign=3Dtop>
<DIV>=
I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demod=
ulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne =
principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequ=
ency then if you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or =
alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz a=
nd you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 4=
5KHz then you will have a intermediate difference frequency at 9KHz, w=
ell within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, b=
ut all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning th=
em on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few =
inches of the recorder.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to reprodu=
ce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with=
 acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce cal=
led the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<D=
IV>Frank R.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <I><w9sz.zack@gmail=
. com></I></B> wrote:<BR></DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16=
,16,255) 2px solid"><BR>From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com><BR>Su=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<BR>Date: Mon=
day, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=3Dyiv100209972>
<DIV id=3Dygrp-t=
ext>
<DIV>
<DIV>Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often&nbsp=
;not recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual=
 point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digit=
al. <BR></DIV>
<DIV>So much we don't know ...</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
=
<DIV>Zack</DIV>

<DIV>I am curio=
us if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any E=
VP in real time.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>I took part in an i=
nvestigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had=
 six video cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for=
 all was being monitored and recorded at a central location. Alas=
, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected to the central l=
ocation. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?</DIV>
